content.p: May contract with an individual or a group, may utilize existing local state public assistance offices, or establish separate welfare medical care offices on a county or multicounty unit basis as found necessary; and

Shall determine both financial and functional eligibility for persons applying for long-term care services under chapter 74.39 or 74.39A RCW as a unified process in a single long-term care organizational unit. [ 2018 c 201 s 7006 ; 2011 1st sp.s. c 15 s 8 ; 1979 c 141 s 338 ; 1959 c 26 s 74.09.080 . Prior: 1955 c 273 s 9 .] NOTES: Findings — Intent — Effective date — 2018 c 201: See notes following RCW 41.05.018 . Effective date — Findings — Intent — Report — Agency transfer — References to head of health care authority — Draft legislation — 2011 1st sp.s. c 15: See notes following RCW 74.09.010 .
